funcdef-repeat.summary: The repeat() CSS function represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.
funcdef-repeat.title: repeat()

funcdef-repeat.summary: The repeat() CSS function represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.
funcdef-repeat.title: repeat()

grid-containers.summary: The display CSS property defines the display type of an element, which consists of the two basic qualities of how an element generates boxes — the outer display type defining how the box participates in flow layout, and the inner display type defining how the children of the box are laid out.
grid-containers.title: display

gutters.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.
gutters.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

gutters.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.
gutters.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

gutters.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 3, the default value for the normal keyword was 0 and not 1em.

gutters.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

propdef-grid.summary: The grid CSS property is a shorthand property that sets all of the explicit grid properties (grid-template-rows, grid-template-columns, and grid-template-areas), and all the implicit grid properties (grid-auto-rows, grid-auto-columns, and grid-auto-flow), in a single declaration.

samsunginternet_android.notes: This was added early so is out of sync with the equivalent Chromium version.

propdef-grid.title: grid

propdef-grid-area.summary: The grid-area CSS property is a shorthand property for grid-row-start, grid-column-start, grid-row-end and grid-column-end, specifying a grid item’s size and location within the grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the edges of its grid area.
propdef-grid-area.title: grid-area

propdef-grid-auto-columns.summary: The grid-auto-columns CSS property specifies the size of an implicitly-created grid column track.
propdef-grid-auto-columns.title: grid-auto-columns

propdef-grid-auto-flow.summary: The grid-auto-flow CSS property controls how the auto-placement algorithm works, specifying exactly how auto-placed items get flowed into the grid.
propdef-grid-auto-flow.title: grid-auto-flow

propdef-grid-auto-rows.summary: The grid-auto-rows CSS property specifies the size of an implicitly-created grid row track.
propdef-grid-auto-rows.title: grid-auto-rows

propdef-grid-column.summary: The grid-column CSS property is a shorthand property for grid-column-start and grid-column-end specifying a grid item's size and location within the grid column by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the inline-start and inline-end edge of its grid area.
propdef-grid-column.title: grid-column

propdef-grid-column-end.summary: The grid-column-end CSS property specifies a grid item’s end position within the grid column by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the block-end edge of its grid area.
propdef-grid-column-end.title: grid-column-end

propdef-grid-column-start.summary: The grid-column-start CSS property specifies a grid item’s start position within the grid column by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement. This start position defines the block-start edge of the grid area.
propdef-grid-column-start.title: grid-column-start

propdef-grid-row.summary: The grid-row CSS property is a shorthand property for grid-row-start and grid-row-end specifying a grid item’s size and location within the grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the inline-start and inline-end edge of its grid area.
propdef-grid-row.title: grid-row

propdef-grid-row-end.summary: The grid-row-end CSS property specifies a grid item’s end position within the grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the inline-end edge of its grid area.
propdef-grid-row-end.title: grid-row-end

propdef-grid-row-start.summary: The grid-row-start CSS property specifies a grid item’s start position within the grid row by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement, thereby specifying the inline-start edge of its grid area.
propdef-grid-row-start.title: grid-row-start

propdef-grid-template.summary: The grid-template CSS property is a shorthand property for defining grid columns, rows, and areas.
propdef-grid-template.title: grid-template

propdef-grid-template-areas.summary: The grid-template-areas CSS property specifies named grid areas.
propdef-grid-template-areas.title: grid-template-areas

propdef-grid-template-columns.summary: The grid-template-columns CSS property defines the line names and track sizing functions of the grid columns.
propdef-grid-template-columns.title: grid-template-columns

propdef-grid-template-rows.summary: The grid-template-rows CSS property defines the line names and track sizing functions of the grid rows.
propdef-grid-template-rows.title: grid-template-rows

typedef-flex.summary: The flex CSS data type denotes a flexible length within a grid container. It is used in grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows and other related properties.
typedef-flex.title: <flex>

valdef-grid-template-columns-fit-content.summary: The fit-content() CSS function clamps a given size to an available size according to the formula min(maximum size, max(minimum size, argument)).
valdef-grid-template-columns-fit-content.title: fit-content()

valdef-grid-template-columns-fit-content.summary: The fit-content() CSS function clamps a given size to an available size according to the formula min(maximum size, max(minimum size, argument)).
valdef-grid-template-columns-fit-content.title: fit-content()

valdef-grid-template-columns-minmax.summary: The minmax() CSS function defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. It is used with CSS Grids.
valdef-grid-template-columns-minmax.title: minmax()

valdef-grid-template-columns-minmax.summary: The minmax() CSS function defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max. It is used with CSS Grids.
valdef-grid-template-columns-minmax.title: minmax()
